p: A better assessment of septic shock patients can be done by using the ratio of arginine and its metabolite asymmetric dimethyl arginine (ADMA), which can block NO production and act as vasoconstrictor; a declining arginine/ADMA ratio was associated with increased mortality ( 161); while an increasing arginine/ADMA ratio in septic patients improved mortality ( 162, 163). Also important is a report showing that intravenous administration in critically ill patients of supra-physiologic doses of arginine did not produce hemodynamic instability ( 164); this may be due to a preferential uptake in septic patients of arginine by leukocytes compared to endothelial cells.
